entry.title: AB Testing: effect of early peeking and what to do about it
entry.summary: This notebook simulates the impact of early peaking on the results of a conversion rate AB test. Early peaking is loosely defined as the practice of checking and concluding the results of an AB test (i.e. based on its p value, statistical significance, secondary metrics etc) before the target sample size and power are reached.

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;

  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */

div.input_area {

/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there

.CodeMirror {

}

  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/

}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */

.CodeMirror pre {

div.output_wrapper {

}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;

  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);

}

div.output_collapsed {

div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {

div.output_area pre {

  vertical-align: baseline;

/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;

  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;

}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {

}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {

}
div.output_latex {

}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */

/* raw_input styles */

  font-size: inherit;

  width: auto;

  vertical-align: baseline;

input.raw_input:focus {

<style type="text/css">.highlight .hll { background-color: #ffffcc }
.highlight  { background: #f8f8f8; }
.highlight .c { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment */
.highlight .err { border: 1px solid #FF0000 } /* Error */
.highlight .k { color: #008000; font-weight: bold } /* Keyword */
.highlight .o { color: #666666 } /* Operator */
.highlight .ch { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Hashbang */
.highlight .cm { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Multiline */
.highlight .cp { color: #BC7A00 } /* Comment.Preproc */
.highlight .cpf { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.PreprocFile */
.highlight .c1 { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Single */
.highlight .cs { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Special */
.highlight .gd { color: #A00000 } /* Generic.Deleted */

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="AB-Testing:-the-impact-of-early-peeking">AB Testing: the impact of early peeking<a class="anchor-link" href="#AB-Testing:-the-impact-of-early-peeking">¶</a></h1><p>This notebook simulates the impact of early peaking on the results of a conversion rate AB test. Early peaking is loosely defined as the practice of checking and concluding the results of an AB test (i.e. based on its p value, statistical significance, secondary metrics etc) before the target sample size and power are reached.</p>
<p>Peeking is discussed extensively in blog posts and some academic research, the purpose of this notebook is to provide snippets of code that allow data analysts to reproduce their AB tests via simulations and measure the effect of peeking on data similar to their own.</p>
<p>The notebook is structured as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Experiment setup via simulations: true power, sample size and type I error</li>
<li>The effect of early peeking: impast of frequency and time of peeking </li>
<li>Visual interpretation of the effect of peeking</li>
<li>Peeking threshold boundaries: can we make early decisions when the p-values excede a certain threshold ? </li>
</ul>
<h2 id="A-non-exhaustive-list-of-references">A non exhaustive list of references<a class="anchor-link" href="#A-non-exhaustive-list-of-references">¶</a></h2><ul>
<li><a href="https://cxl.com/blog/peeking-sequential-testing/">Merritt Aho: AB testing peeking deep dive</a></li>
<li><a href="https://deliveroo.engineering/2018/10/22/how-to-experiment-rapidly-without-losing-rigour.html">Deliveroo</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.lucidchart.com/blog/the-fatal-flaw-of-ab-tests-peeking">Lucid Chart: the fatal flaw of ab test peeking</a></li>
<li><a href="https://codeascraft.com/2018/10/03/how-etsy-handles-peeking-in-a-b-testing/">How Etsy handles peeking</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.evanmiller.org/how-not-to-run-an-ab-test.html">Evan Miller: how not to run an AB test</a>- </li>
<li><a href="http://varianceexplained.org/r/bayesian-ab-testing/">Bayesian AB testing is not immuned to peeking</a></li>
<li><a href="http://library.usc.edu.ph/ACM/KKD%202017/pdfs/p1517.pdf">KDD Paper: peeking</a></li>
<li><a href="https://medium.com/@SkyscannerEng/the-fourth-ghost-of-experimentation-peeking-b33890dcd3de">Skyscanner Engineering</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Summary-of-results">Summary of results<a class="anchor-link" href="#Summary-of-results">¶</a></h2><p>These simulations confirm that early peeking leads to significant degradations in true type I errors in case of the null hypothesis being true. Waiting for longer before peeking reduces this effect but may still result in negative consequences</p>
<p>One trade-off is to decide on decision boundaries when peeking, based on the cost/benefit of stopping futile or promising experiments early. These simulations show that in cases where agility and speed of experimentation are important, such trade-offs can be highly beneficial. They come at the expense of type I error inflation, which can be compensated by increasing the overall sample size slightly.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Experiment-1)-Two-groups,-same-average,-50/50%,-early-peeking-and-stop">Experiment 1) Two groups, same average, 50/50%, early peeking and stop<a class="anchor-link" href="#Experiment-1)-Two-groups,-same-average,-50/50%,-early-peeking-and-stop">¶</a></h1><p>Here we will use two normal distributions with the same mean and variance.</p>
<ul>
<li>$X0$ : $N \sim (\mu = 0.8, \sigma = 0.3)$</li>
<li>$X1$ : $N \sim (\mu = 0.81, \sigma = 0.3)$</li>
<li>$X2$ : $N \sim (\mu = 0.8, \sigma = 0.3)$</li>
</ul>
<p>Recall that</p>
<ul>
<li>$H_0$: $\mu_1 = \mu_2$ and $H_1$: $\mu_1 \neq \mu_2$</li>
<li>Type 1 error is calculated as: $P(\text{reject} | H_0)$</li>
<li>Power is calculated as: $P(\text{reject} | H_1)$</li>
<li>Early peeking leads to the end of the experiment. </li>
</ul>
<p>Since we simulate experiment using the true distribution of $H_0$ and $H_1$, we are able to calculate the true values of the above. This is only possible via simulations, but can be useful to estimate type I and error of real AB tests if we assume that the population data is similar to the simulated data.</p>
<h3 id="Imports">Imports<a class="anchor-link" href="#Imports">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">os</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">scipy.stats</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">stats</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">seaborn</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">sns</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">statsmodels.stats.power</span>

<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1">#Making seaborn the default styling </span>

<span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_option</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'display.float_format'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%.5f</span><span class="s1">'</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Population-distributions">Population distributions<a class="anchor-link" href="#Population-distributions">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#The population distributions, scale is std</span>
<span class="n">X_1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rvs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">14000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">X_2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rvs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.81</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">14000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#X_1 = X_1[(X_1 <= 1) & (X_1 >= 0)]</span>
<span class="c1">#X_2 = X_2[(X_2 <= 1) & (X_2 >= 0)]</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">distplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">distplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlim</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Distribution of X1 and X2'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Pre-experiment-calculations">Pre-experiment calculations<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pre-experiment-calculations">¶</a></h2><p>Given we want to measure a difference of 100 basis points, i.e. from 80% to 81%, how many users do we need to achieve 80% power ? Note this is a two sample, two sided z test:</p>
<ul>
<li>For a 50/50 split we need 14k users in each group to get 80% power</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="Calculating-power-and-sample-size">Calculating power and sample size<a class="anchor-link" href="#Calculating-power-and-sample-size">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Z_crit</span>
<span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">05</span>
<span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.2</span> <span class="c1">#Power = 1-beta</span>

<span class="c1">#Paramaters</span>
<span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">mu1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.80</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.81</span>
<span class="n">sigma0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">0.3</span>
<span class="n">n0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10000</span>

<span class="c1">#Intermediate calculations</span>
<span class="n">z_alpha2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ppf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">z_beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ppf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">beta</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">kappa</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n0</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n1</span>
<span class="n">sigma_pooled</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n0</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">sigma0</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n0</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">n1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="p">)</span>


<span class="c1">#Manual power</span>
<span class="c1">#from http://powerandsamplesize.com/Calculators/Compare-2-Means/2-Sample-Equality</span>
<span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">sigma_pooled</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">power_manual</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cdf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">z_alpha2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cdf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">z_alpha2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Manual sample size given power</span>
<span class="n">sample_size_n1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">kappa</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="o">*</span> <span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">sigma_pooled</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">z_alpha2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">z_beta</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span>
<span class="n">sample_size_n0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">kappa</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">sample_size_n1</span>

<span class="c1">#Using statsmodel and standardized effect size, difference between the two means divided by the standard deviation. effect_size has to be positive.</span>
<span class="n">power_statsmodel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">statsmodels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">power</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tt_ind_solve_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">effect_size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">sigma_pooled</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nobs1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ratio</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="n">n0</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">power</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alternative</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'two-sided'</span> <span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#print('z_alpha/2 = ',z_alpha2, '  z = ', z)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Sample size for 80% power: n0='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sample_size_n1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="s1">'and n1 ='</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sample_size_n0</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Power for given sample size = '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">power_manual</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span> 
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Sample size for 80% power: n0= 14128 and n1 = 14128
Power for given sample size =  0.6543
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ttest_two_side_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">'''Manual power calculation for two sided t test power</span>
<span class="sd">    from http://powerandsamplesize.com/Calculators/Compare-2-Means/2-Sample-Equality</span>
<span class="sd">    '''</span>
    
    <span class="c1">#Intermediate calculations</span>
    <span class="n">z_alpha2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ppf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">z_beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ppf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">beta</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1">#power</span>
    <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">sigma_pooled</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">pwer</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cdf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">z_alpha2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">norm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cdf</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">z_alpha2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">pwer</span>


<span class="n">ttest_two_side_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">81</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">14000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">14000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">)</span>    
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.7964213092264733</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Confirming-by-simulations">Confirming by simulations<a class="anchor-link" href="#Confirming-by-simulations">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>

#Power from simulations
means0, means1, means2 = [], [], []
t_test_p_H0, t_test_p_H1 = [], []

for i in range(5000):
    sample0 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = 0.8, scale = .3, size = n0)
    sample1 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = 0.81, scale = .3, size = n1)
    sample2 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = 0.8, scale = .3, size = n1)
    means0.append(sample0.mean().copy())
    means1.append(sample1.mean().copy())
    means2.append(sample2.mean().copy())

    #Computations for true alpha and power
    t_test_p_H0.append(stats.ttest_ind(sample0,sample2)[1].copy())
    t_test_p_H1.append(stats.ttest_ind(sample0,sample1)[1].copy())

#Computing true alpha and power from simulations
simulated_alpha = (np.asarray(t_test_p_H0) < alpha).sum() / len(t_test_p_H0)
simulated_power = (np.asarray(t_test_p_H1) < alpha).sum() / len(t_test_p_H1)
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 21.3 s, sys: 107 ms, total: 21.4 s
Wall time: 24 s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Manual Power = '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">power_manual</span> <span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Simulated power = '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">simulated_power</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'and alpha ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">simulated_alpha</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Not sure why stats model gives different results ? </span>
<span class="c1">#Since manual, bootstrap and website all give the same value, we will ignore statsmodel</span>
<span class="c1">#print('Stats model power = ', power_statsmodel)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Manual Power =  0.6543457917372257
Simulated power =  0.6408 and alpha = 0.0544
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Simulating-early-peeking">Simulating early peeking<a class="anchor-link" href="#Simulating-early-peeking">¶</a></h1><p>Assume that each day, we increase the number of users in the sample by 1,000. What would happen if we peaked only once, on day 5, every day ?</p>
<p>Note that:</p>
<ul>
<li>x0 corresponds to the control with mean = 0.8</li>
<li>x1 corresponds to a variant with true mean = 0.81 (i.e. a true alternative)</li>
<li>x2 corresponds to a variant with true mean = 0.8 (i.e. a true null)</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
days = 14
sims = 500
H0_frame, H1_frame, H2_frame= np.empty(days).reshape(1,days), np.empty(days).reshape(1,days), np.empty(days).reshape(1,days)

#Looping through simulations
for i in range(sims-1):
    
    x0, x1, x2, x3 = np.empty(0), np.empty(0), np.empty(0), np.empty(0)
    t_test_p_H0, t_test_p_H1, t_test_p_H2 = np.empty(0), np.empty(0), np.empty(0)
    
    #Looping through days 
    for d in range(days):
        #print(d)
        daily_x0 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = mu0, scale =sigma0, size = 1000)
        daily_x1 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = mu1, scale = sigma1, size = 1000)
        daily_x2 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = mu0, scale = sigma0, size = 1000)
        daily_x3 = stats.norm.rvs(loc = mu0-0.03, scale = sigma0, size = 1000)

        x0 = np.append(x0, daily_x0.copy())
        x1 = np.append(x1, daily_x1.copy())
        x2 = np.append(x2, daily_x2.copy())
        x3 = np.append(x3, daily_x3.copy())
        #print(x0.shape)

        t_test_p_H0 = np.append(t_test_p_H0, stats.ttest_ind(x0,x2)[1].copy())
        t_test_p_H1 = np.append(t_test_p_H1, stats.ttest_ind(x0,x1)[1].copy())   
        t_test_p_H2 = np.append(t_test_p_H2, stats.ttest_ind(x0,x3)[1].copy())   
    
    #Stacking sim loop results
    H0_frame = np.vstack( (H0_frame,t_test_p_H0))
    H1_frame = np.vstack( (H1_frame,t_test_p_H1 ))
    H2_frame = np.vstack( (H2_frame,t_test_p_H2 ))

#Saving as DataFrame outside of the sim loop    
H0_frame = pd.DataFrame(H0_frame)
H1_frame = pd.DataFrame(H1_frame)
H2_frame = pd.DataFrame(H2_frame)
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 24.4 s, sys: 122 ms, total: 24.6 s
Wall time: 27.5 s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Calculations-and-insights">Calculations and insights<a class="anchor-link" href="#Calculations-and-insights">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Peeking-every-day">Peeking every day<a class="anchor-link" href="#Peeking-every-day">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Inflates the true type 1 error from 5% to 20%, or a 4x increase</li>
<li>Inflates the true power from 80% to 87.5%, or a 9% relative increase</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">number_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">number_days</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">H1_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">expected_power</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ttest_two_side_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma0</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">beta</span><span class="p">)</span>    

<span class="c1"># Under a true H0, how many simulations have 1 or more day with pvalue < alpha</span>
<span class="c1">#print('H0 sims with 1 or more days positive =', H0_positive_sims) </span>

<span class="c1"># i.e. True type 1 error in this scenario compared to expected</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True type 1 error when peaking each day:'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span><span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">number_sims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%, Expected ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Under a true H1, how many simulations have 1 or more day with pvalue < alpha</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Power when peaking each day:'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True = '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">H1_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">number_sims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%, Expected ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">expected_power</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>True type 1 error when peaking each day:
True = 23.4 %, Expected = 5.0 %

Power when peaking each day:
True =  88.6 %, Expected = 79.64213092264733 %
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Visual-interpretation-:-H0-scenario">Visual interpretation : H0 scenario<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visual-interpretation-:-H0-scenario">¶</a></h3><p>Why does peeking inflate type I error ? Given two identical distributions, i.e. a true null hypothesis, we plot</p>
<ul>
<li>Top chart: the number of positive experiments and proportion of total, each day of peeking</li>
<li>Bottom two charts:<ul>
<li>In grey, experiments that are negative</li>
<li>In red, experiments that have a p value < 0.05, i.e. false positives</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Calculations for the bar plot        </span>
<span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[],</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Loop through columns</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">:</span>
    
    <span class="c1">#Calculate temp results</span>
    <span class="n">positive_tests</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span>
    <span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">positive_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
    <span class="c1">#Drop the positive tests from frame</span>
    <span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="c1">#Save in frame and calculate proportions    </span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="n">c</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H0_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> \
                       <span class="s1">'total_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'remaining_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
 

<span class="c1">#Figure setup</span>
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">17</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">colspan</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>
  
    
<span class="c1">#Bar plot</span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kind</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bar'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Positive tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'H0 scenario - Peek every day'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kind</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'line'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">secondary_y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tmp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tmp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f total'</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="c1"># Line plots</span>
<span class="n">alpha_plot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.05</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iterrows</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="c1">#Non peeking plot</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'lightgrey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="c1">#Peeking plot</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'lightgrey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
        
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">alpha_plot</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'darkred'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'0.05'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'upper right'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Type I errors: Read on day 14'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'p value'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">)</span>        
        
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">alpha_plot</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'darkred'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'0.05'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'upper right'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Type I errors: Peek every day'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'p value'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">number_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">number_days</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">expected_power</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ttest_two_side_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma0</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">beta</span><span class="p">)</span>    

<span class="c1"># Under a true H0, how many simulations have 1 or more day with pvalue < alpha</span>
<span class="c1">#print('H0 sims with 1 or more days positive =', H0_positive_sims) </span>

<span class="c1"># i.e. True type 1 error in this scenario compared to expected</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True type 1 error when peaking each day:'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span><span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">number_sims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%, Expected ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Sum of </span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f total ='</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(),</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Visual-interpretation-:-H1-scenario">Visual interpretation : H1 scenario<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visual-interpretation-:-H1-scenario">¶</a></h3><p>Why does peeking inflate power ? Given two truly differeny distributions, i.e. a true alternative hypothesis, we plot</p>
<ul>
<li>Top chart: the number of positive experiments and proportion of total, each day of peeking</li>
<li>Bottom two charts:<ul>
<li>In grey, experiments that are negative</li>
<li>In red, experiments that have a p value < 0.05, i.e. true positives</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Calculations for the bar plot        </span>
<span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[],</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Loop through columns</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">:</span>
    
    <span class="c1">#Calculate temp results</span>
    <span class="n">positive_tests</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span>
    <span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">positive_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
    <span class="c1">#Drop the positive tests from frame</span>
    <span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="c1">#Save in frame and calculate proportions    </span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="n">c</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H1_frame_copy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">number_positive_tests</span><span class="p">,</span> \
                       <span class="s1">'total_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'remaining_tests'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">number_remaining_tests</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
 

<span class="c1">#Figure setup</span>
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">colspan</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplot2grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>
  
    
<span class="c1">#Bar plot</span>
<span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kind</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bar'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positive_tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day of peek'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Positive tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'H1 scenario - Peek every day'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kind</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'line'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">secondary_y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tmp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f total'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="c1"># Line plots</span>
<span class="n">alpha_plot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.05</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iterrows</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="c1">#Non peeking plot</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'lightgrey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="c1">#Peeking plot</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'lightgrey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
        
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">alpha_plot</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'darkred'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'0.05'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'upper right'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Power: Read on day 14'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'p value'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">)</span>        
        
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">alpha_plot</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'darkred'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'0.05'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'upper right'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Power: Peek every day'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'p value'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Day'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>


<span class="c1">#Printing sums and overal stats</span>
<span class="n">number_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">number_days</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">H1_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">expected_power</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ttest_two_side_power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mu0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma0</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">x0</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">beta</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">beta</span><span class="p">)</span>    

<span class="c1"># Under a true H1, how many simulations have 1 or more day with pvalue < alpha</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Power when peaking each day:'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'True = '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">H1_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">number_sims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%, Expected ='</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">expected_power</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'%'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Sum of </span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f total ='</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_bar_res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive/total'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(),</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Effect-of-peeking-as-a-function-of-the-day-of-peek">Effect of peeking as a function of the day of peek<a class="anchor-link" href="#Effect-of-peeking-as-a-function-of-the-day-of-peek">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Type-1-error-for-2-day-peeking,-as-a-function-of-the-day">Type 1 error for 2 day peeking, as a function of the day<a class="anchor-link" href="#Type-1-error-for-2-day-peeking,-as-a-function-of-the-day">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">type1_error</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">days</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[],</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">alpha_plot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">d</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">d</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">H0_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span> 
    <span class="n">H1_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">d</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">H1_frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span> 

    <span class="n">type1_error</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span><span class="n">H0_positive_sims</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">number_sims</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">days</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">d</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Plotting    </span>
<span class="n">result_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="n">days</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'type1'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">type1_error</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'alpha'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">alpha_plot</span><span class="p">})</span>    
<span class="n">result_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'navy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Day of peek'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Type I error for 1-day peeking'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

"/>
